title: The Scoring Blackout
outcome: Three days after the graffiti gatherings, Stenograd wakes up to a citywide blackout of BCI scores. People lose access to their ratings: public transport, job sites, and housing entry grind to chaos. Manual processes take their place, and trust in the Council shatters as frantic factions scramble for new authority. Secret logs reveal Halden planned for this as a 'resilience test.' As weeks pass, Council members are forced into open debate with citizens, for the first time in years.

events.description: Sudden failure of BCI score visibility citywide. Daily life is disrupted: transportation jams, housing access stalls, and citizens cannot prove credentials at workplaces.

Council splits over what Halden's 'resilience test' logs really mean. The Innovators argue for open forums with residents; Directorate pushes for new emergency authority to reimpose order by any means.
Makeshift civic assemblies form in public squares, forcing Council members into direct Q&A with angry citizens as manual decisions now impact thousands.
Fractures deepen as some neighborhoods experiment with independent scoring practices, while others demand complete abolition of ranking systems.
Trust in BCI collapses as Council power weakens further. Residents openly question whether they need centralized compliance at all, sparking citywide debate on the future of governance.
